New Records: The New York Mets became the first team since 2002 to not have any strikeouts in a postseason game.
Pete Alonso extended his playoff streak with a crucial three-run home run.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso launched a three-run homer in the first inning, setting the tone for the Mets' victory.
Francisco Lindor had a standout performance with multiple hits and RBI, including an RBI triple.
The Mets displayed resilience, overcoming previous setbacks and a struggling Flaherty to secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets, as underdogs, showed up with a strong lineup ready to perform.
Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of the game and the team's determination.
Post-Match Reflections: Players and the manager expressed pride in the team's performance and their ability to continue playing.
The Mets' ability to rise under pressure was a key factor in their victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at Citi Field with a sellout crowd of 43,841.
Sean Manaea was lined up to start Game 6, while the Dodgers faced a thin rotation.
Others: The Dodgers' Freddie Freeman struggled with a sprained ankle, affecting his performance.
